column4: I started downloading 8.04 (not the live CD, but through the update manager) and.. it froze. Anyone have any idea what to do?
you tryed to update GUtsy?
yes
ok if it was downloading then it was downloading, this means nothing was installed
really? (it's stuck at "installing upgrades) .. should i just reboot then?
I  updated a computer earlier,   (this being my second time updating to Hard
how many updates has it installed?
can you open the update manager again?
no, no programs will open.. and I don't know how many updates it's installed, but it stuck at just 7 min left
nothing about a partial upgrade?
nothing about a partial upgrade?
no, it doesn't say anything in particular, it's just frozen

have you got a Live CD?   just in case  there is a boot up problem of some sort after re boot.  I mean it seems to me that re booting is your only option if it has frozen.  and then hopeing that it will come up saying there are updates  and then you install those yeah
it was frozen on downloading packages or installing them?
i have got a live CD, luckily enough.. stuck on the"installing upgrades step"
i'm not! mine's dead :)

ok with 7 minutes  from the end,  well  that probably means most stuff was installed.  however not quite everything,  but if you do re boot,  you can probably just boot up some kernel and  get the last updates.   if on the other hand for some reason there is a boot up problem,  at least then you got a Live CD and can come back here or something for help
..what would i do to get the last updates?

if it works after re boot,  the update manager will probably come up saying there are some more updates.  click on that and it will say a prtical upgrade was done probably,  then you can download the remaining updates
also it might still say a new version is avaialbe  if so best to use that
oh, ok. i thought i might have to do something special. thank-you for your help!!
yeah no problem
